intro: Melicope honoluluensis, commonly known as the Honolulu melicope, is a small evergreen tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in moist, mesic habitats. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
